name: Tomato and Bocconcini Salad
author: Sarah
summary: This salad should be made with the freshest ingredients possible, and is a delight as a side to most any meal! If you can't find, or don't have bocconcini, you could use another size of fresh mozzarella instead.
ingredients: 4 cups baby spinach, rinsed and dried
1 cup fresh bocconcini cheese, cut into bite-sized pieces
directions: Combine the olive oil, vinegar, garlic, salt, and black pepper in a jar with a lid; set aside
Gently combine the spinach, arugula, tomatoes, bocconcini cheese, and onion in a pretty serving bowl
Shake the salad dressing vigorously to combine, and drizzle over the salad to serve
